verses.verse: To the chief Musician <S%H5329><s%> <S%H8764><s%> upon Gittith <S%H1665><s%>, A Psalm <S%H4210><s%> for the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Korach <S%H7141><s%>. How amiable <S%H3039><s%> are thy tabernacles <S%H4908><s%>, O YY <S%H3068><s%> TZva'ot <S%H6635><s%> !

My soul <S%H5315><s%> longeth <S%H3700><s%> <S%H8738><s%>, yea, even fainteth <S%H3615><s%> <S%H8804><s%> for the courts <S%H2691><s%> of the YY <S%H3068><s%>: my heart <S%H3820><s%> and my flesh <S%H1320><s%> crieth out <S%H7442><s%> <S%H8762><s%> for the living <S%H2416><s%> 'Elohim <S%H410><s%>.

Yea, the sparrow <S%H6833><s%> hath found <S%H4672><s%> <S%H8804><s%> an house <S%H1004><s%>, and the swallow <S%H1866><s%> a nest <S%H7064><s%> for herself, where she may lay <S%H7896><s%> <S%H8804><s%> her young <S%H667><s%>, even thine altars <S%H4196><s%>, O YY <S%H3068><s%> TZva'ot <S%H6635><s%>, my King <S%H4428><s%>, and my 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>.
Blessed <S%H835><s%> are they that dwell <S%H3427><s%> <S%H8802><s%> in thy house <S%H1004><s%>: they will be still praising <S%H1984><s%> <S%H8762><s%> thee. Selah <S%H5542><s%>.
Blessed <S%H835><s%> is the man <S%H120><s%> whose strength <S%H5797><s%> is in thee; in whose heart <S%H3824><s%> are the ways <S%H4546><s%> of them.

Who passing <S%H5674><s%> <S%H8802><s%> through the valley <S%H6010><s%> of Baca <S%H1056><s%> <S%H8676><s%> <S%H1057><s%> make <S%H7896><s%> <S%H8799><s%> it a well <S%H4599><s%>; the rain <S%H4175><s%> also filleth <S%H5844><s%> <S%H8799><s%> the pools <S%H1293><s%>.
They go <S%H3212><s%> <S%H8799><s%> from strength <S%H2428><s%> to strength <S%H2428><s%>, every one of them in TZiyon <S%H6726><s%> appeareth <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8735><s%> before 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>.

O YY <S%H3068><s%> 'Elohim <S%H430><s%> TZva'ot <S%H6635><s%>, hear <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8798><s%> my prayer <S%H8605><s%>: give ear <S%H238><s%> <S%H8685><s%>, O 'Elohim <S%H430><s%> of Ya`akov <S%H3290><s%>. Selah <S%H5542><s%>.
Behold <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8798><s%>, O 'Elohim <S%H430><s%> our shield <S%H4043><s%>, and look <S%H5027><s%> <S%H8685><s%> upon the face <S%H6440><s%> of thine anointed <S%H4899><s%>.

For a day <S%H3117><s%> in thy courts <S%H2691><s%> is better <S%H2896><s%> than a thousand <S%H505><s%>. I had rather <S%H977><s%> <S%H8804><s%> be a doorkeeper <S%H5605><s%> <S%H8705><s%> in the house <S%H1004><s%> of my 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>, than to dwell <S%H1752><s%> <S%H8800><s%> in the tents <S%H168><s%> of wickedness <S%H7562><s%>.

For the YY <S%H3068><s%> 'Elohim <S%H430><s%> is a sun <S%H8121><s%> and shield <S%H4043><s%>: the YY <S%H3068><s%> will give <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8799><s%> grace <S%H2580><s%> and glory <S%H3519><s%>: no good <S%H2896><s%> thing will he withhold <S%H4513><s%> <S%H8799><s%> from them that walk <S%H1980><s%> <S%H8802><s%> uprightly <S%H8549><s%>.
O YY <S%H3068><s%> TZva'ot <S%H6635><s%>, blessed <S%H835><s%> is the man <S%H120><s%> that trusteth <S%H982><s%> <S%H8802><s%> in thee.
